feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student demonstrates a working financial app: they implemented a generator that computes investment allocations, expected returns, monthly savings targets, and sends a personalized email (Implement + Verify). The Discover and Reflect stages show clear financial intent and iterative validation, supporting a PASS under the moderate evaluation standard.
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates a functioning AI integration (OpenAI model + calculator + automated email) that produces concrete, actionable outputs (specific allocations and expected returns) and adjusts strategy by horizon—evidence of effective integration. Reflection on iterative tweaking and limitations shows understanding of how the AI component was developed and can be improved, meeting the standards for a thorough PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "our generator right here uses our OpenAI chat model and a calculator to calculate the investments"
"for our mini project 3, we had to build an AI tool that can help us um, analyze or explain something on a financial decision"
"Step one, the gap analysis. you need an additional $6,000. Um, you have 48 months to save. So, you need to save $125 per month."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover (identified a financial decision problem and goals), Implement (built code/generator that computes allocations and sends emails), Verify/Reflect (ran the tool, showed emailed output with gap analysis and portfolio recommendations, and reflected on tweaks and accuracy).
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates a working financial app: they implemented a generator that computes investment allocations, expected returns, monthly savings targets, and sends a personalized email (Implement + Verify). The Discover and Reflect stages show clear financial intent and iterative validation, supporting a PASS under the moderate evaluation standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "our generator right here uses our OpenAI chat model and a calculator to calculate the investments"
"first is Vanguard VTI ... They want me to place 40% of my uh what is it? $12,000 into this and a projected return uh annually of 7%."

"it did take a lot of tweaking to do because it can give you confusing information at first or not enough information and not explaining the choices behind why they decided to put this certain stock in your portfolio"
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: identified a concrete user need (personal investment goal scenarios). Implement: built code using an OpenAI chat model to generate allocations, rationale, and automated email output. Reflect: iterated on prompts/logic, noted limitations and possible improvements.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates a functioning AI integration (OpenAI model + calculator + automated email) that produces concrete, actionable outputs (specific allocations and expected returns) and adjusts strategy by horizon—evidence of effective integration. Reflection on iterative tweaking and limitations shows understanding of how the AI component was developed and can be improved, meeting the standards for a thorough PASS.
